title: Gary Johnson Impact on the 2016 Election

content.description:
If Third-Party Voters Were Forced to Choose Between the Two Major-Party Candidates in the 2016 Election

Source: NBC News and Survey Monkey poll, 2016

(L) - Libertarian

(G) - Green
content.question: What do the data in the bar graph indicate about how Gary Johnson’s candidacy affected the 2016 election?

choices.label: The data in the bar graph illustrate that Gary Johnson's candidacy likely increased voter turnout because people were excited about his candidacy.
The data in the bar graph show that since Gary Johnson’s supporters were split between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump, his candidacy did not have an impact on the outcome of the election.
The data in the bar graph illustrate that Gary Johnson’s focus on getting his name on the ballot in swing states helped Hillary Clinton’s election effort in those swing states.
The data in the chart show that Gary Johnson attracted mostly voters who leaned toward Donald Trump, which could have helped him win the popular vote.

content.answer: The data in the bar graph show that since Gary Johnson’s supporters were split between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump, his candidacy did not have an impact on the outcome of the election.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
